fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Bitstream encoding and file format designed for efficient distribution of sound files over moderate bandwidth connections, e.g., Apple's iTunes music service; QTA_MP3 may be used at higher data rates for better fidelity.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Bitstream encoding and file format designed for efficient distribution of sound files over moderate bandwidth connections, e.g., Apple's iTunes music service; QTA_MP3 may be used at higher data rates for better fidelity.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Generally used for final-state, end-user delivery.

fdd:localUse.fdd:preference: The Broadcast WAVE format (either version, WAVE_BWF_1 or WAVE_BWF_2), wrapping LPCM, is preferred as the archival master format for mono and stereo audio when reformatting analog sound recordings.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Fully documented. For wrapper, see QuickTime; for bitstream, see MP3_ENC.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Used by the Apple iTunes music distribution service; may be in diminished production or discontinued as AAC receives wider use. See also QuickTime and MP3_ENC.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:externalDependencies: Files from iTunes can be played on an iPod device and as many as five computers authorized by the enduser's agreement; see About Music Store Authorization and Deauthorization.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:techProtection: Files from iTunes can be played by endusers who use the required Apple ID and Password. The Apple iTunes FairPlay system to protect content is the subject of a Green Paper from the Digital Media research initiative at the Berkman Center of Harvard Law School. See also QuickTime.

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: Reported by an iTunes user; files said to be protected according to iTunes policies.

fdd:internetMediaType.fdd:note: None specifically identified as of 2004-05-26; see QuickTime.

fdd:values.fdd:note: Four-character code (as Hex) identifying the MP3 audio codec (CBR only, pre-QT4.1), from QuickTime File Format, p. 103 or p. 109.
Four-character code identifying the MP3 audio codec (CBR and VBR, QT4.1 and later), from QuickTime File Format, p. 103 or p. 109.

fdd:footNote.fdd:text: There seem to have been at least two printings of the specification carrying the same date. These were not systematically compared by the compiler of this Web page. Pagination varies between these two printings.
